page.title: 14Energy in the Home (II)
page.content: Most homes also have a tumble drier, a sterio/hi-fi unit, a lawn mower, toaster, coffee percolator and food mixer. The following items also exist in the home of the 80's in order of popularity, computers,dish-washers , videos and sewing machines. There has been an increase in the number of electrically powered games, such as train sets and car race games, which have replaced, the wind-up or 'push along' toys of the past. Another major change in the use energy is in the consumption of petrol.All people surveyed had at least one family car; a large percentage having two and some even three.
